data.title: Tributes paid to mum, 47, who ‘suddenly’ passed away and nanna
data.meta_description: Our thoughts are with those who have lost a loved one
data.text:
Tributes have been paid to a 47-year-old mum who ‘sadly and suddenly’ passed away and an adored nanna-of-14.

Announcing the passing of a loved one in the Evening Gazette is a long standing tradition and we are proud of the trust placed in us to make these important announcements.

Every notice published to our newspaper and news site also appears on funeral-notices.co.uk - the UK’s number one site for death notices and memoriams. Every notice remains online forever providing friends and families with a lifelong tribute to their loved one, a safe place online to share memories, add tributes, photographs and make donations in memory.

Each week we pay tribute to the loved ones remembered in our area with a funeral notice and online tribute page. To read the latest announcements and add tributes to those from our area who have passed away, or to create a funeral notice yourself, click here. Alternatively, you can create a notice by calling our team on 01482908084.

READ MORE: Much-loved Middlesbrough rigger tragically died after walking in front of HGV on A66

READ MORE: Ingleby poisoning probe: Alleged attempted murder victim remains in 'serious' condition in hospital

Here are a selection of notices published earlier this week.

Death Notices

Raymond Allan

Formerly of Redcar. Ray, passed away peacefully on 3rd February 2024, aged 92 years. Funeral service is to take place on Tuesday 20th February in Kirkleatham Crematorium Chapel at 3pm. All enquiries to Stanway & Garnett Funeral Service 114 High Street, Redcar, Cleveland TS10 3DH. Tel: 01642477257.

Pat Ann Allen

(Nee Taylor) passed away peacefully on Tuesday 6th February, aged 80 years. Dearly loved and deeply missed. Funeral service to be held on Wednesday 14th February at 2pm in the Parish of Saint Thomas, New Marske. No flowers please, any donations will be kindly accepted to Teesside Hospice. All enquiries to Greeves & Sons, Redcar. 01642490444.

Veronica Mary Allinson

(Nee Major) peacefully at The Poplars Care Home on February 11th. Veronica aged 91 years. Beloved wife of the late George, a dearly loved mam, gran and great gran. Veronica will be sorely missed by all who knew her. Requiem Mass to celebrate Veronica's life will take place on Wednesday February 28th in St Patrick's Church, Thornaby at 10.00am followed by interment at Thornaby Cemetery. Family and friends please meet at the church. The family would like to thank all staff at The Poplars Care Home for their loving care and attention shown to Veronica. All enquiries to Irene Jessop Funeral Service, Luke House, 81 - 83 Lanehouse Road, Thornaby, TS17 8AF. Tel: 01642601736.

John Aston

(Dave ) peacefully in Hospital on 7th February, with family by his side, John David Aston (Dave) aged 75 years. Much loved husband to Pamela, beloved father to Sarah and David, father in law to Richard and Donna and a loving Grandad to Zak, Jacob, Millie, Ben and Joseph. Dave was dearly loved and will be sadly missed by all who knew him. Service and Cremation will take place on Thursday 22nd at 12 noon in Kirkleatham Memorial Park. Would friends and family kindly meet at the Crematorium. Family flowers by request, donations in lieu if so desired to Parkinson's UK and Scleroderma and Raynaud's UK. Resting and enquiries to Harry Thompson Funeral Service Loftus. 01287643375.

Doreen Bell

(Nee Booty) (Dot) Peacefully in Windermere Grange Care Home on February 4th, aged 89 years. Devoted wife of the late George, much loved mum of Lynne, dear mother in law of Chris, doting nana of Matthew and also a loving aunt. Service and Cremation to take place in the Chapel of St Hilda, Teesside Crematorium on Tuesday February 20th at 10:45am.

Derek Bell

Passed away age 61 on 12th of February 2024 surrounded by family. He will be sadly missed by his family here in the UK as well as his family over in Kentucky USA. A memorial service will be held at Norton Methodist Church 18/02/24 at 4pm and afterwards at Norton Village Club formerly known as Norton Working Men’s club.

Susan Louise Bilton

Passed away on 2nd February 2024 aged 48 years. Funeral service to be held in St Bede's Chapel, Teesside Crematorium on Monday 19th February 2024 at 9:00am. Rest in peace. Middlesbrough Co-op Funeralcare 398 Linthorpe Road Middlesbrough TS5 6HF.

Jacqueline Ann Bowes

Peacefully on February 12th Jackie aged 68 years. Beloved wife of the late Robert. Funeral service and cremation takes place on Tuesday February 27th at 1.30pm in St Bedes Chapel, Teesside Crematorium. Will friends please meet at the crematorium chapel. All enquiries to Co-op Funeralcare, Memorial House, 398 Linthorpe Road tel 01642 828301

June Butterworth

(Nee Hamilton) peacefully in Woodside Grange Care Home on February 11th with her loving family close by her side, June aged 86 years. Loving wife of Ronnie, devoted mam of David, Garry, Janet and Susie, very dear mother in law of Elaine, Vicki, Colin and David, beloved sister of Ronnie and the late Fred and John, a loving sister in law and aunt and also a dearly loved nanna and great nanna who shall be deeply and sorely missed. Service to take place on Thursday February 29th in St Paul's Church, Thornaby at 10.15am followed by burial within Thornaby Cemetery. Would friends please meet at church. Floral tributes, if desired, to Irene Jessop Funeral Service, Luke House, 81-83 Lanehouse Road, Thornaby. Tel : 01642 601736 or donations in lieu if so desired to St Paul's Church. A collection plate shall be available in church.

James Calvert

Passed away peacefully surrounded by his loving family on 4th February, James aged 75 years. Beloved Partner of the late Irene, devoted Dad of Andrew, Michelle and Shenine. A much loved Grandad and Friend to many. Will be sadly missed by all. Funeral service to be held on Tuesday 20th February in St Bede's Chapel, Teesside Crematorium at 3pm. All enquiries to Rose Funerals Middlesbrough Tel 01642820795.

Dennis Carroll

Passed away on February 12th, Dennis, aged 69 years. Funeral service and cremation takes place on Tuesday February 27th at 9.15am in St Hildas Chapel, Teesside Crematorium. All enquiries to Co-op Funeralcare, Memorial House, 398 Linthorpe Road tel 01642828301.

Julie Carter

Peacefully in Teesside Hospice on February 10th, Julie aged 65 Years. Beloved partner of the late Michael, a much loved sister of Stephen, Paul and Debra, a sadly missed sister-in-law of Neil and the late Susan, a dearly missed aunt of Rachel, Patrick, Jack, Olivia and Lucy and loved by many. Funeral service and cremation to take place on Friday February 23rd at 3.15pm in the chapel of St Hilda Teesside Crematorium. Would friends please meet at the Crematorium chapel. Family flowers only, donations in lieu if so desired to Teesside Hospice. A donation box will be provided after the service. All enquiries to The Co-op Funeralcare Memorial House 398 Linthorpe Road Tel 01642828301.

Marian Chandler

Peacefully in hospital with her family by her side on January 27th Marian aged 87 years. Dearly loved wife of the late Ken, treasured Mum of Ian and Jillian, adored Grandma to Lauren and Kacey and dearly loved by John, Jake and Tyler. Service to take place at St Andrew & St George United Reform Church, Yarm Lane, Stockton on Tuesday 20th February at 1pm prior to committal at Maplewood Chapel, Stockton Crematorium at 2pm. Immediate family flowers only please, donations in lieu of flowers if so desired to Alzheimer's Society.

Graeme Chapman

Passed away peacefully on February 2nd, aged 64 years. Devoted husband of Bev. Beloved son of Jean and the late Bob. Dearly loved brother of Ian. Also a dear nephew, brother in law, uncle, great uncle and friend. Would family and friends please meet for service and cremation at Kirkleatham Crematorium on Friday February 23rd at 11am. Family flowers only please. Donations if desired are in support of Ward 14 James Cook University Hospital and G.R.A.C.E (Greyhound, rescue and co-ordinated emergencies).

John Christon

Peacefully whilst in hospital on January 26th, John aged 89 years. Beloved only son of the late Dora and Ernie Christon of Thornaby on Tees. Dear cousin of Norman and Brian Mankin and godfather to Richard and Jeremy Mankin. Funeral service and cremation to take place on Monday 26th February at 11am in Maplewood Chapel Stockton Crematorium. Friends please meet at Maplewood Chapel. All enquires to Colin McGinley Funeral Service 235a Acklam Road Middlesbrough TS5 7AB Tel. 01642826222.

Beverley Church

(Bev) peacefully in hospital on February 6th Bev aged 86 years. Beloved husband of Mavis, a much loved dad of Julie, Karen and Jonathan, dearly missed grandad of Lewis, Liam, Sam and Jake and a sadly missed brother of Ian also brother-in-law to Alwyn and Keith. Funeral service and cremation to take place on Monday March 4th at 12 Noon in Kirkleatham Crematorium. Would friends please meet at the Crematorium chapel. Family flowers only, donations in lieu if so desired to Ward 4 James Cook University Hospital. A donation box will be provided after the service. All enquiries to Marton Co-op Funeralcare 36 Stokesley Road Tel 01642313184.

Linda Clark

On February 6th suddenly but peacefully at home, Linda, aged 65 years of Stockton. Darling wife of David, precious mam and cherished nana, a dear sister, sister-in-law and auntie. Service to take place in St Mary's Church, Norton Green on Tuesday February 20th at 10.00am prior to interment in Durham Road Cemetery. Friends please meet at church. Resting at and any floral tributes to Crake & Mallon Funeral Service, 45 Norton Road, Stockton Tel 01642611716.

Brian Coldwell OBE

Peacefully in hospital, Brian aged 91 years. Will be deeply missed by his wife Pat, daughters Helen and Sheila and their families. Funeral service to take place on Friday 23rd February at 11:45am in Marton Methodist Church, followed by private committal service. Family flowers only please, donations in lieu if so desired to Teesside Hospice. All enquiries to Coop Funeralcare Marton, 36 Stokesley Road. 01642313184.

John William Collins

Passed away suddenly on 4th February, John aged 82 years. Beloved Husband of the late Bridget, Much loved Dad of Michelle and the late Lana, Cherished Grandad of Chantelle, Dean, Michaela and Ivan, Treasured Brother of Norma also a dear Brother in law, Father in law, Uncle and Friend to many. Will be sadly missed by all. Funeral service to be held on Thursday 22nd February in St Hilda's Chapel, Teesside Crematorium at 10.15am followed by interment in Thorntree R.C Cemetery. All enquiries to Rose Funerals, Middlesbrough Tel 01642820795.

Joyce Julia Cooper

Peacefully on 4th February 2024 in Woodside Grange Care Home Thornaby, aged 73 years. Dearly beloved wife of the late David Cooper, much loved Mother of Andrea and David. Loving Nana to Ryan, Kristie, India, Summer, Mia and Willow and Great Nana of Jacob, Ruby Rose and Maya. Service and cremation to take place in St Hilda's Chapel Teesside Crematorium at 3.15pm on Wednesday 21st February, would friends please meet at the crematorium chapel. Family flowers only please, donations in lieu if so desired to Macmillan Cancer Support. Following the service everyone is invited to join the family for light refreshments and to share further memories of Joyce, at Thornaby Sports and Leisure Club (The Nash Club), Tedder Avenue, Thornaby, TS17 9JP.

Stephanie Copeland

Sadly and suddenly on 28th January 2024 Stephanie passed away aged 47. A much loved mum to James and Melissa, Stephanie was a devoted grandmother to her 3 grandchildren Owen Luke and Ariella. Can family and friends please meet at 3.00pm 16th February 2024 at Kirkleatham crematorium. Flowers and donations welcome. Enquiries to Roseberry funeral service Tel: 01642756324

Dorothy Cowley

Passed away peacefully in her care home. Dorothy, aged 92 years. Dorothy will be greatly and sadly missed by all her loving family and friends. Flowers are welcome but if you would prefer, donations can be made to The Great North Air Ambulance Service and The Butterwick Hospice. The Celebration of Dorothy's life will take place on Wednesday 21st February in Norton Methodist Church at around 2pm following a short Committal at Teesside Crematorium, St Hilda's Chapel at 1.15pm.

Graham Charles Cummings

Peacefully in hospital February 2nd aged 66. Beloved husband of Dawn, a much loved Dad of David and Helen. Step Dad to Andrew and Thomas. Grandpa to Eleanor, Olivia, Emily and Effie and Brother to Dan. The funeral will be held at Kirkleatham Crematorium on Tuesday 20th February at 12 noon. Followed by a celebration of Graham's life at Redcar Rugby Club. All enquiries to Roseberry Funeral Service Marske 01642293107.

John Cutler

(Edward) John died peacefully at Alice House Hospice on 5th Feb 2024, aged 71, with his family by his side. He was the dearly beloved husband of Ann and loving father of Shaun, and father-in-law to Jane. He was also the much-loved grandfather of Harrison and Hannah, a dear uncle and caring brother to Paul and Marie. He will be greatly missed by his family and friends. His funeral service will take place on Friday 23rd of February at Stockton Crematorium Junction Road, Stockton-on-Tees TS19 9NA at 3:30 pm. Family and friends are welcome. A reception will be held afterwards at the Smith's Arms, Carlton Village, Carlton, Stockton-on-Tees, TS21 1EA. Charitable donations in John's memory, can be made to Alice House Hospice.

Brenda Dick

(Nee Kettlewell) peacefully in hospital on February 1st, aged 83 years. Dearly loved wife of the late Bill, very dear friend of John and a much loved mam of Paul and Billy. Service and Cremation to take place in the Chapel of St Hilda, Teesside Crematorium, on Wednesday February 21st at 11:15 a.m. Donations in lieu of flowers to Cancer Research UK or the Great North Air Ambulance.

Ann Donovan

Passed away peacefully on February 9th at Silver Mews Care Home, aged 87 years. Beloved mother to Karen and Denise and mother-in-law to Howard. Proud grandmother of Sara-Jayne, Kailem and Nicola. A cherished great grandmother, and friend to many. Service to take place at Kirkleatham Crematorium on Tuesday February 27th at 2.00pm Friends, please meet at the Chapel. All enquiries to Fawcett & Hetherington, Eston. 0164 459555.

Pamela Duce

Peacefully on February 10th at the Butterwick Hospice after an illness bravely fought, Pam aged 78 years. Devoted wife of Derek, much loved mam of Stuart and Sharon, dear mother-in-law of Gary, cherished nana of Ellie. Also a loving sister, sister-in-law and aunt. A celebration of Pam's life will take place on Tuesday 20th February at 1pm in Maplewood Chapel Stockton Crematorium. Friends please meet at Maplewood Chapel. Family flowers only please. Donations if so desired to the Butterwick Hospice. A collection plate will be available outside the chapel. All enquiries to Colin McGinley Funeral Service 235a Acklam Road Middlesbrough TS5 7AB Tel. 01642826 222

Maurice Finch

Peacefully at home on February 8th surrounded by his loving family, Maurice aged 86 years. Dearly loved husband of Margaret, much loved Dad of Peter and Deborah, dear father-in-law of Nick. Also a loving Grandad to Jack. Funeral service and cremation to take place on Thursday 22nd February in the chapel of St Hilda Teesside Crematorium at 1.15pm. Family and friends please meet at the crematorium. Family flowers only please. Donations in lieu if so desired to RSPB. All enquiries to Colin McGinley Funeral Service 235a Acklam Road Middlesbrough TS5 7AB Tel. 01642826222.

Ernie Fryett

Peacefully in Roseleigh Care Home on February 7th Ernie aged 90 years. Beloved husband of the late Margaret, a much loved dad of Ray, Neil, Peter and Ian, a sadly missed father-in-law of Jan, Pat, Elaine and Karen and a dearly missed grandad and great grandad. Funeral service and cremation to take place on Monday February 19th at 10.30am in the chapel of St Bede Teesside Crematorium. Would friends please meet at the crematorium chapel. Family flowers only, donations in lieu if so desired to Roseleigh Care Home. A donation box will be provided after the service. All enquiries to The Co-op Funeralcare Memorial House 398 Linthorpe Road Tel 01642 828301.

Rita Maria Garbutt

After a hard battle, Rita passed away peacefully on 5th February 2024 aged 78 years. Treasured Mam of Joanne, Debbie and Maryk. Mother-in-Law of Sarah. Adored Nanna of Kayley, Lauren, Jenny, Chelsea, Bryani, Jordan, Daniel, Charlie, Evie and Louis. Great Nana to many including Layton who she brought up from being young. Funeral service to be held on Monday 26th February in St Bede's Chapel, Teesside Crematorium at 1pm. Followed by refreshments at the Dorman's Club. Donations welcome to Macmillan Nurses. All enquiries to Rose Funerals, Middlesbrough Tel 01642820795.

Wendy Hall

(Nee Appleby) dearly loved sister of Carole. Aunt of Scott, Stuart, Hayley, the late Graham and their families. Will be sadly missed always. "When tomorrow starts without me, And I'm not here to see, If the sun should rise and find your eyes, All filled with tears for me."

Eileen Hewitt

(Nee Burdess) (09.01.1941- 30.01.2024) (of Wolviston village) Passed away suddenly at The University Hospital of North Tees after an extremely short illness aged 83. Beloved, adored and devoted mum of Catherine. Respected sister of John and much loved aunt and great aunt. Will be lovingly remembered by friends far and wide. Family and friends please meet at St Peter's Church, Wolviston at 1pm on 20th February 2024, for funeral service and interment. Everyone is invited to the Wellington Inn, Wolviston Village, to raise a glass of champagne to Eileen and a life lived to the fullest. Family flowers only, donations in lieu if so desired, to Catcote Academy, a charity which was loved and supported by Eileen in recent years.

Ivy Hewitt

Passed away peacefully in hospital surrounded by her loving family on 5th February aged 84 years. A loving wife of Billy, much loved mam of Linda and John, dear mother in law of Margaret, treasured nanna of 6 and devoted great nanna of 11 Forever in our hearts Service to take place 1pm on Wednesday 21st February at Kirkleatham Memorial Park followed by interment within the grounds. All enquiries to Roseberry Funeral Service Redcar tel 01642756324.

Jean Alison James

(Née Fletcher) peacefully in her sleep on February 4th at The Poplars Nursing Home, Jean aged 71 years of Kendal Road, Stockton. Beloved sister of Paul and sister in law of Chris, step sister of Guy a loving aunt of Sarah & Joe, Anna & Jamie also a dear great aunt of Henry, Rosie, Grace and William. Service to take place at Stockton Crematorium, Bluebell Chapel, on Monday February 26th at 11:30am. Friends please meet at the crematorium. Family flowers only, any donations in lieu if desired to the Alzheimer's Society. Feel free to wear an item of pink or purple clothing, Jean's favourite colours.

Mary Jane Jones

Mary from Marske by the Sea, passed away peacefully on Saturday 27th January at James Cook University Hospital, aged 86 years. Devoted wife to Ken. Dearly loved mother to Neil and Michael and mother in law to Lesley. Treasured grandmother to Rachel, Gillian, Martyn, Elizabeth, Matthew and Sean. Also, a dear sister, sister in law, aunt and friend. Funeral service to take place on Monday 19th February at St Bedes Roman Catholic Church, Marske at 2:15pm. Followed by cremation at Kirkleatham Crematorium. Family flowers only please. Donations, if so desired, will be gratefully received for Macmillan Cancer Support. The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen nor touched but are felt in the heart. Any enquiries please contact Coop Funeralcare, The Wynd, Marske on Tel 01642756887.

Richard Martin Kelly

Peacefully in hospital on January 29th Richard aged 79 years of Guisborough. Beloved husband of Pam, dearly loved dad of the late Nigel and loved and respected by all who knew him. Funeral service at Kirkleatham Crematorium on Monday February 19th at 2.00pm prior to cremation. Will friends please meet at the crematorium. Family flowers only please, a collection box will be available for donations in lieu of flowers, if so desired, for Ward 7, James Cook University Hospital.

Gloria May Lal

(Nee Heaviside) passed away peacefully on February 6th Gloria aged 78 years of Guisborough, formerly Great Ayton. Beloved wife of the late Dr Jai, dearly loved mum of Richard, Stephen and Helen, also a much loved mother in law, yaya, nana, sister, aunty and cousin. Funeral service in Guisborough Parish Church on Thursday February 22nd at 2:15pm prior to cremation. Will friends please meet at church and are also invited to attend the committal at Kirkleatham Crematorium. Family flowers only please. A collection plate will be available at church for donations in lieu of flowers, if so desired for the General Critical Care Unit at James Cook University Hospital and Action for Pulmonary Fibrosis.

Dennis Lee

Passed away peacefully on 10th February in Willow Green care home, Darlington aged 92 years. Beloved Husband of the late Shirley, much loved Dad of Karen, loved Father-in-law of Dave, treasured Grandad of Kathryn, Kelly and Laura and also a special Great Grandad, Brother and Uncle. A private family burial will take place in Stokesley Churchyard on Tuesday 27th February. Donations can be made to Motor Neurone Disease Association via the following link : https://dennis-lee-1931-2024.muchloved.com/ Any enquiries to Rea Funeral Service, 10 Three Tuns Wynd, Stokesley, TS9 5DQ. Tel: 01642711999.

Jeffrey Alan Lodge

Taken suddenly but peacefully at home on Saturday 3rd February 2024. Much loved husband and life-long best friend to Maxine, adored Dad to Chris, Michael, and Andrew. Father-in-law to Lucy, Rachel, and Zoe. Treasured Grandad to Alex, Theo, and Freddie. Dearly loved brother of John, Susan, Julie, and the late Dot and David. Also brother-in-law, uncle, and friend to many. Forever in our hearts. Service to be held on Monday 26th February at Kirkleatham Crematorium at 11:00am. Family and friends all welcome to celebrate Jeff's life at the Crematorium. Family flowers only please, all donations please to the RNLI.

Colin Mahoney

Sunderland Suddenly but peacefully at home surrounded by his loving family on 5th February aged 67 years, Colin. Forever loving partner of Trish, cherished brother of Trevor, much loved brother in law of Susan, a dear dad of Clare, grandad of Kayleigh, also a dear friend of many. Please meet for service in Sunderland Crematorium on Wednesday 21st February at 10am. Family flowers only please, donations in lieu if so desired to St. Benedict's Hospice, a collection box will be available at the Crematorium. All enquiries to Gavin J. Reynolds & Son Family Funeral Directors. 78 Sea Road, Fulwell, Sunderland. 01915487000.

Stephen Mark

It is with great sadness, we announce the death of our beloved brother Stephen Mark. Who after a long illness passed away on the 1st February 2024 aged 66. Stephen is a much loved Brother to Beverley, Kenny, Trudy, Ian, Vicky, Dameone and the late, Linda, Lesley and Alan. Service to take place on 20th February 2024 at St Anne's Church, Whale Hill at 1.00pm. Then onto St Bedes, Teesside Crematorium at 2.00pm. As kids we lived together. We fought we laughed we cried, we shared our dreams, our plans and some secrets to. We grew to find we had a love that is very strong today. Its a love shared by our family that will never fade away.

May Mason

(Née Powell) peacefully in her sleep on February 7th, May, aged 88 years (of Brookfield). Devoted wife of the late Jim, dearly loved mam of Elaine, Jimmy, John and Trish also a much loved mother-in-law, nanna, great-nanna, great-great-nanna and sister. Funeral service to be held at St Hilda's Chapel, Teesside Crematorium on Tuesday February 20th at 11.15am prior to cremation. Friends please meet at St Hilda's Chapel. Family flowers only please, donations in lieu, if desired to the Alzheimer's Society. Retiring collection at the chapel. All enquiries to Relph Funeral Service 22 Stokesley Road Marton TS7 8DX 01642927863.

Jean McCabe

(Nee McGough) peacefully on February 11th, Jean, aged 84 years. Beloved wife of the late Joe, much loved mam of Jan, Joseph, Teresa, Kev and the late Michael, dear mother-in-law of Wayne, Allison, Tony and Sarah. Also a loving nanna of Linzi, Jenni, Dani, Emily, Matty, Aaron, Ross, Matt, Luke, Adam, Daniel, Zoe, Kris and Izzy. Dear great nanna of Reese, Cole, Madison, Raven and Harry. Funeral Service and cremation takes place on Tuesday February 20th at 1.30pm in St Bedes Chapel, Teesside Crematorium. Will friends please meet at the crematorium chapel. Floral tributes welcome or donations in lieu if so desired to Dementia UK, a donation box will be provided after the service. Resting at Co-op Funeralcare, Memorial House, 398 Linthorpe Road tel 01652828301.

Janet McLaren

Sadly but peacefully after a short illness Janet aged 69, passed away on the 3rd February 2024, with her devoted Husband by her side. Devoted Wife to Paul. Cherished Mam to Tracy, Vicky and Suzanne. Adored Nana to Jamie, Laila, Freddie and Pippa and a loving Great Nana to Tommy. Respected Mother-In-Law to Lee, Kimberley and Asad. A beautiful friend to many. Funeral service to be held on Tuesday 20th February in St.Bedes Chapel, Teesside Crematorium, at 10am. Family flowers only. Donations welcome to target Ovarian Cancer Charity on the day. All enquiries to Rose Funerals, 01642820795.

Elsie McManus

(Nee Aspery ) peacefully in hospital on February 7th surrounded by her loving family, Elsie aged 83 years. Beloved wife of the late Charlie, much loved mam of Lynn, Ken and Jacky, dear mother-in-law of Val, Stewart and the late Steve, a dear sister, loving grandma of Richard, Adam, Mathew and Domanic. Also a gram's to Amelia, Ivy and Lyra. A celebration of Elsie's life will take place on Friday 16th February in the chapel of St Bede Teesside Crematorium at 1pm. Family and friends please meet at the chapel and afterwards at The Motor Club, Coulby Newham. Family flowers only please. Donations in lieu if so desired to Diabetes UK. Resting at Colin McGinley Funeral Service 235a Acklam Road Middlesbrough TS5 7AB Tel. 01642826222.

Ross Michie

Retired Director of Neshams Of Teesside at home on 11th February surrounded by his family Ross aged 89 years of Briggswath. Beloved Husband of the late Avril. Loving Father of Don, Alistair, Stewart, Sheila and the late Norman and their families. Funeral service to be held on Friday 1st March at St John's Church Sleights at 1pm prior to interment in churchyard. Family flowers only please. Donations if desired to Mind or Macmillan Cancer Support.

Violet Mitcheson

Died peacefully at home with her family at her side on 2nd February after a short illness, aged 93 years. Devoted wife of Ralph, much loved mum to Philip, Valerie and the late Diane, cherished grandma to Lucy, dear mother-in-law to Richard and Graeme, caring sister to Audrey and brother-in-law Tom, and admired brother-in-law Malcolm. Funeral service to take place on Wednesday 21st February in St Hilda's Chapel, Teesside Crematorium at 10.15am. Would friends please meet at the Crematorium Chapel. No flowers by request please, donations in lieu if so desired to South Tees Hospitals Charity Breast Care Clinic. A donation box will be provided after the service. All enquiries to The Co-op Funeralcare Memorial House 398 Linthorpe Road Tel 01642828301.

Arthur Nimmo

(Of Middlesbrough) passed away while surrounded by his family on Monday 22nd January at James Cook University Hospital, aged 87 years. Devoted husband to Sheila Nimmo. Dearly loved father to Susan, Andrew, Janet, Tracey and the late Peter & Stephen. A dear father in law to John, Nigel, Gareth and the late Janice. Treasured grandfather to 10 grandchildren and 13 great grandchildren. Also, a friend to many. Funeral service to be held on Monday February 19th at 11:00am in Kirkleatham Crematorium. Family flowers only please. Donations, if so desired, will be gratefully received for Maxi's Mates. Sadly missed by all R.I.P "Where's that doggie in the Window".

Valerie Peacock

(Née Smith) From Fairfield, Stockton on Tees. Passed peacefully in hospital following a short illness. Mother of Paul, Gary and Christopher Pearson. Service at Stockton Crematorium, Bluebell Chapel on Thursday 22nd February at 9.30am.

Kathleen Puntin

(Nee Henderson) on February 10th, Kathleen aged 94 years. Much loved wife of Andrew, dearly loved mam of Helen and Linda, dear sister of Alan. Also a loving mother-in-law, grandma and nan. A celebration of Kathleen's life will take place on Friday 23rd February in Maplewood Chapel Stockton Crematorium at 11am. Family and friends please meet at the crematorium. Family flowers only please. Donations in lieu if so desired to Dementia UK. All enquiries to Colin McGinley Funeral Service 3 Beechwood Road Eaglescliffe TS16 0AE Tel. 01642786200.

Peter Quinn

(Hairdresser) peacefully at Teesside Hospice on February 14th after a short illness, Peter aged 79 years. Devoted husband of Joan, much loved dad of Delfine, Leon and Sarah, dear father-in-law of Marty, Billie and Nick. Also a cherished grandad, great-grandad, loving brother, brother-in-law and uncle. A celebration of Peter's life will take place on Monday 26th February at 1.30pm in St Bede's Chapel Teesside Crematorium. Friends please meet at St Bede's Chapel. No flowers please. Donations if so desired to Teesside Hospice. A collection plate will be available outside the chapel. Resting at Colin McGinley Funeral Service 235a Acklam Road Middlesbrough TS5 7AB Tel. 01642826222.

Keith Sanderson

Suddenly and unexpectedly in North Tees Hospital on 21st January Keith aged 80 years. A much loved husband and dearest best friend of Wendy. Treasured and devoted dad to Trudi and Neil. Precious grandad of Scott, Matthew, Pippa, Luke, Beau, Ryan and Rhys and a lovely great grandad of Kaine, Zyrah and Blakely, also a highly respected father in law of Brian and Lisa. God came and stood beside your bed, took your hand and gently said, come with me to a better land, You've suffered more than you can stand. Funeral service to take place on Monday 19th February in St Aidan's Church, Tintern Avenue, Billingham at 11am followed by a private committal at Stockton Crematorium. Family flowers only by request please, donations in lieu if so desired to Rosedale Rehabilitation Centre, Stockton on Tees.

Tim Seaton

Peacefully after a short illness in hospital on January 29th Tim aged 61 years of New Marske, formerly Oxbridge, Stockton. Devoted and loving husband of Deb, much loved dad of John and Andrew, adored grandad of Abel and Clay, proud son of the late Mollie and Roy and very respected and loved son in law of Roy and the late Elsie. Funeral service at Kirkleatham Crematorium on Tuesday February 20th at 10:30am prior to cremation. Will friends please meet at the crematorium. Family flowers only please. A collection box will be available at the crematorium for donations in lieu of flowers, if so desired, for the Great North Air Ambulance.

Sylvia Beryl Smith

(Nee Brown) passed away peacefully in hospital on January 27th aged 86 years. Devoted and loving wife to the late Derrick Dearly loved mother to Stephen and his wife Tracy, Peter and his partner Bron, previously mother in law to Michelle. Loving nana to Maria and her husband Anthony, Adele and her partner Mat, David and his partner Donna, Gemma and her husband Callum. Great grandmother to Ellie and her partner Warren, Lucy, Martha, Harley and Millie Also a dear sister to Carol, Kenny, the late Margret and the late Olga, aunt and friend to many, Would family and friends please meet for service at St George's Church, Teesville on Tuesday February 20th at 11:00am. Followed by burial in Eston Cemetery. Following the burial meet up downstairs at the Eston Labour club to celebrate Sylvia's life. Family flowers only please. Donations if desired are for the British Heart Foundation.

William Speck

(Bill) peacefully on February 7th whilst in hospital, Bill aged 87 years. Devoted husband of Margaret, much loved dad of Janet and Peter, dear father-in-law of Steve and Lesley, cherished grandad of Rachel, Liam and Olivia. Also a loving brother, brother-in-law and uncle. A celebration of Bill's life will take place on Thursday 22nd February at 11am in St Bede's Chapel, Teesside Crematorium. Friends please meet at St Bede's Chapel and afterwards at North Ormesby Working Men's Club. Family flowers only please. Donations if so desired to the Renal Unit, James Cook University Hospital. A collection plate will be available outside the chapel. Resting at Colin McGinley Funeral Service 235a Acklam Road Middlesbrough TS5 7AB Tel. 01642826222.

Martin Stott

It is with great sadness we announce the loss of Martin Stott aged 77 years. Martin formerly of Stockton passed away peacefully at his home in Thornaby, on Sunday 4th February surrounded by his family. Martin is now reunited with his beloved wife Marion and also his brothers and sisters. A devoted dad to Gary and Joanne, and a dear father-in-law to Mandy. He will be lovingly remembered by his grandchildren and great-grandchildren and sadly missed by his many friends. If you would like to pay your respects, you are welcome to attend the funeral service at St. Peters Church, Yarm Rd, Stockton-on-Tees on Monday 19th February at 1.00pm followed by burial at Durham Road Cemetery. Refreshments to follow at The Buffs Social Club, Norton Road.

A much loved and respected Uncle, Brother-In-Law and Father-In-Law. A treasured grandad, great grandad, cousin and a good friend to many. Funeral service to be held on Monday 19th February in St Bede's Chapel, Teesside Crematorium at 3pm. Family flowers only, donations in lieu to the Great North Air Ambulance please. All enquiries to Rose Funerals 01642820795.

Family and friends please meet at the crematorium. Family flowers only please. Donations, if desired, in lieu of flowers are to Cancer Research UK. A donation box will be available at the service.

Louise Ann Wales

Sadly, at home on February 6th Louise passed away aged 58 years. Beloved wife of Paul, cherished Mam of Daniel and loved Mama of Harry. A treasured Daughter, Sister, Aunty, Neice, Cousin, Colleague and Friend - Louise was loved and admired by many. 'You fought so bravely over the last 18 months' Funeral Service to be held on Friday February 23rd at 9.45am in St. Hilda's Chapel, Teesside Crematorium. Louise will be resting at Coop Funeralcare, Memorial House Linthorpe Road. Flowers welcomed (Louise loved flowers) or donations will be given to the Beverley School, Middlesbrough (an all-age specialist school for students with a diagnosis of autism and associated learning needs). A donation box will be provided after the service.
